channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken slabbed/concreted footway surface presumably due to HGV overriding - major trip hazard esp as so poorly lit at night - footway has to be used as it is a heavily used vehicular cut-through so walking on carriageway is not viable., 25th April
item.description:
Queen's Retreat 1-way section on only footway on this link, which is extremely poorly lit at night, at side of 88 Gloucester Rd
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Gloucester Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Just before the wooded area coming from the A436, 25th April
item.description:
There are two potholes in this location, one on each side of the rd, they are the width if the car so they cannot be avoided
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Street, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is no access to the A38. A fence and hedge block the access although the way marks and the definitive map show the footpath accessing the road from the paddock and not from the drive to Salters Hill House which is currently the only way to get to the road, 25th April
item.description:
Where the footpath access the A38. Coming from Tredington the footpath way marks direct you to access the road through a hedge but there is no access. The definitive map appears to agree with the way marks. There is also no footpath sign on the verge of the A38 identifying the footpath coming from the Deerhurst direction and going into the paddock towards Tredington This footpath is included in the "A Pilgrimage Walk from Tewkesbury Abbey" leaflet
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 25th April
item.description:
CW Edge Kerbing 900mmx120mm TM: Give and Take Lift and replace broken kerb. Outside No 8 STATS required (CW Edge Kerbing & Channels)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At least 1 of the four trees on GCC's footway between the two vehicular accesses to Jenner Court & Sandfields Care Homes has root egress that is dangerous to OAP residents of two loc'ns mentioned as they walk to bus stop, 25th April
item.description:
GCC's footway on south side of road between the two vehicular accesses of Jenner Court & Sandfields Care Homes has in vicinity of bus stop. Missed by your highway inspectors & tree assessors!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Georges Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Slabs uneven wit several sat significantly proud of surrounding slabbed footway and posing significant trip hazard (missed by inspectors!), 25th April
